1. Dementia (e.g. Alzheimer's disease, vascular dementia)
2. Delirium
3. Psychosis (e.g. schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
4. Neurodegenerative disorder (e.g. Parkinson's disease, Huntington's disease)
5. Brain tumor or other intracranial lesion
6. Infection (e.g. meningitis, encephalitis)
7. Autoimmune disorder (e.g. dementia with Lewy bodies)
8. Nutritional deficiency (e.g. vitamin B12 deficiency)

It's important to note that this is not an exhaustive list, and a thorough diagnostic evaluation would be needed to determine the underlying cause of the symptoms.
